Rick,

Thanks for the info. So it was basically volcanic
run-off deposits. I wonder if the black sand beaches
of The Big Island of Hawaii wouldn't be a bad source
for tamahagane. Actually Hawaii as a whole is rich in
iron in the soil it explains all the red dirt. Anyone
have a big enough electro magnet I could borrow next
time I go to Hawaii? 

Bob R
